body_content.explanation: a tall North American plant with groups of pink or pale purple flowers:
examples: The bluish-purple, dense, flat-topped flower clusters and the dark green leaves make Joe-pye weed hard to miss.
The ancient, weedy path up the mountain follows the the stream through thick stands of joe-pye weed and goldenrod.
Joe-Pye weed grows along roadsides, in meadows, and in fields as far north as Maine and as far south as Georgia.
